meanings.definition: To cut or shape with a chisel.
meanings.sent1: I will chis the wood to make a small sculpture.
meanings.sent2: He chisels the stone carefully to create a beautiful statue.
meanings.sent3: The artist decided to chis a smile into the wooden figure.
meanings.sent4: Her words chiselled away at his confidence.
meanings.sent5: With each precise chis, the sculpture began to take shape.

meanings.definition: A sharp-edged tool used for cutting or shaping wood, stone, or metal.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a chis to carve intricate designs.
meanings.sent2: She carefully placed the chis back in the toolbox.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to hide the shiny chis in its nest.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a chis, shaping her thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The old chis had seen many years of hard work and craftsmanship.
